intro: Donia fruticosa, commonly known as the shrub of the genus Donia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, woody structure and produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a leathery texture, while its fruits are small berries that may be edible. Donia fruticosa is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
